context_bundle.summary: Inter-Process Communication mechanisms including named pipes, sockets, shared memory, and file-based IPC for agent coordination

onboarding.quick_start: Choose IPC method based on constraints: file-based for PhiVector (mandatory), named pipes for same-machine, sockets for network
common_patterns: File-based IPC: Use when processes cannot communicate directly (PhiVector)
Named pipes: Fast same-machine communication with System.IO.Pipes
Sockets: Network communication TCP/UDP for distributed agents
Shared memory: Fastest but complex, requires synchronization primitives
Message format: JSON for human-readable, MessagePack for performance
known_errors: PhiVector agents cannot use direct IPC (DC constraint)
File locks required for atomic file-based IPC operations
Named pipes require proper ACLs for security
